questions.text: I have a dog that keeps barking at night. What can I do to make it stop?
questions.title: Dog barking at night

questions.text: My dog is afraid of thunderstorms. How can I help it overcome this fear?
questions.title: Dog afraid of thunderstorms

questions.text: What are some good toys for dogs to keep them entertained?
questions.title: Toys for dogs

questions.text: My dog keeps chewing on furniture. How can I stop this behavior?
questions.title: Dog chewing on furniture

questions.text: What are some good training techniques for teaching a dog to sit?
questions.title: Training a dog to sit

questions.text: How often should I bathe my dog?
questions.title: Dog bathing frequency

answers.text: You can try using white noise machines or calming music to drown out external noises that may be triggering your dog's barking.
answers.title: Try white noise machines

answers.text: Make sure your dog gets enough exercise during the day to tire them out and reduce their energy levels at night.
answers.title: Exercise your dog

answers.text: Create a safe and comfortable space for your dog during thunderstorms, such as a cozy den or a crate covered with blankets.
answers.title: Create a safe space

answers.text: Consider using anxiety-reducing products like thunder shirts or calming pheromone sprays to help your dog feel more secure during thunderstorms.
answers.title: Try anxiety-reducing products

answers.text: Interactive puzzle toys and treat-dispensing toys are great options to keep dogs mentally stimulated and entertained.
answers.title: Try interactive puzzle toys

answers.text: Consider getting toys that are designed to withstand heavy chewing, such as Kong toys or durable rubber toys.
answers.title: Get durable chew toys

answers.text: Provide your dog with appropriate chew toys and redirect their chewing behavior to those toys whenever you catch them chewing on furniture.
answers.title: Provide chew toys

answers.text: Use bitter apple spray or other taste deterrents on the furniture to discourage your dog from chewing on it.
answers.title: Try taste deterrents

answers.text: Start by luring your dog into a sitting position with a treat, and then reward them with the treat when they successfully sit.
answers.title: Use treat luring

answers.text: Consistency is key. Practice the sit command with your dog regularly and reward them every time they respond correctly.
answers.title: Be consistent

answers.text: The frequency of bathing depends on your dog's breed, coat type, and activity level. Generally, bathing once every 4-6 weeks is sufficient for most dogs.
answers.title: Bathing frequency

answers.text: Avoid over-bathing your dog as it can strip their skin of natural oils. Regular brushing can help keep their coat clean and healthy between baths.
answers.title: Avoid over-bathing
